1_SELECT_name.0: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE 'Y%';
1_SELECT_name.1: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '%Y';
1_SELECT_name.2: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '%x%';
1_SELECT_name.3: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '%land';
1_SELECT_name.4: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE 'C%' AND name LIKE '%ia';
1_SELECT_name.5: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '%oo%';
1_SELECT_name.6: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '%a%a%a%';
1_SELECT_name.7: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '_t%' ORDER BY name;
1_SELECT_name.8: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '%o__o%';
1_SELECT_name.9: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '____';
1_SELECT_name.10: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE capital;
1_SELECT_name.11: SELECT name FROM world WHERE capital LIKE concat(name, ' City');
1_SELECT_name.12: SELECT capital, name FROM world WHERE capital LIKE concat('%', name, '%');
1_SELECT_name.13: SELECT capital, name FROM world WHERE capital LIKE concat(name, '%') AND NOT capital = name;
1_SELECT_name.14: SELECT name, REPLACE(capital, name, '') AS extension FROM world WHERE capital LIKE concat(name, '%') AND NOT REPLACE(capital, name, '') = '';

2_SELECT_from_World.0: SELECT name, continent, population FROM world;
2_SELECT_from_World.1: SELECT name FROM world WHERE population >= 200000000;
2_SELECT_from_World.2: SELECT name, gdp/population as 'per_capita_GDP' FROM world WHERE population >= 200000000;
2_SELECT_from_World.3: SELECT name, population/1000000 as 'population_in_millions' FROM world WHERE continent = 'South America';
2_SELECT_from_World.4: SELECT name, population FROM world WHERE name = 'France' OR name = 'Germany' OR name = 'Italy';
2_SELECT_from_World.5: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '%United%';
2_SELECT_from_World.6: SELECT name, population, area FROM world WHERE area > 3000000 OR population > 250000000;
2_SELECT_from_World.7: SELECT name, population, area FROM world WHERE area > 3000000 XOR population > 250000000;
2_SELECT_from_World.8: SELECT name, ROUND(population/1000000, 2) as 'population_in_millions', ROUND(gdp/1000000000, 2) as 'GDP_in_billions' FROM world WHERE continent = 'South America';
2_SELECT_from_World.9: SELECT name, ROUND(gdp/population, -3) as 'per_capita_GDP' FROM world WHERE gdp >= 1000000000000;
2_SELECT_from_World.10: SELECT name, capital FROM world WHERE LENGTH(name) = LENGTH(capital);
2_SELECT_from_World.11: SELECT name, capital FROM world WHERE LEFT(name, 1) = LEFT(capital, 1) AND name <> capital;
2_SELECT_from_World.12: SELECT name FROM world WHERE name LIKE '%a%' AND name LIKE '%e%' AND name LIKE '%i%' AND name LIKE '%o%' AND name LIKE '%u%' AND name NOT LIKE '% %'

3_SELECT_from_Nobel.0: SELECT yr, subject, winner FROM nobel WHERE yr = 1950;
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.1: SELECT winner FROM nobel WHERE yr = 1962 AND subject = 'literature';
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.2: SELECT yr, subject FROM nobel WHERE winner = 'Albert Einstein';
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.3: SELECT winner FROM nobel WHERE subject = 'peace' AND yr >= 2000;
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.4: SELECT * FROM nobel WHERE subject = 'literature' AND yr >= 1980 AND yr <= 1989;
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.5: SELECT * FROM nobel WHERE winner IN('Theodore Roosevelt', 'Thomas Woodrow Wilson', 'Jimmy Carter', 'Barack Obama');
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.6: SELECT winner FROM nobel WHERE winner LIKE 'John%';
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.7: SELECT * FROM nobel WHERE (subject = 'physics' AND yr = 1980) OR (subject = 'chemistry' AND yr = 1984);
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.8: SELECT * FROM nobel WHERE yr = 1980 AND subject NOT IN('chemistry', 'medicine');
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.9: SELECT * FROM nobel WHERE (subject = 'Medicine' AND yr < 1910) OR (subject = 'Literature' AND yr >= 2004);
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.10: SElECT * FROM nobel WHERE winner = 'Peter GrÃ¼nberg';
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.11: SELECT * FROM nobel WHERE winner = 'Eugene O''Neill';
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.12: SELECT winner, yr, subject FROM nobel WHERE winner LIKE 'Sir%' ORDER BY yr DESC, winner;
3_SELECT_from_Nobel.13: SELECT winner, subject FROM nobel WHERE yr = 1984 ORDER BY subject IN ('physics','chemistry'), subject, winner;

4_SELECT_within_SELECT.0: SELECT name FROM world WHERE population > (SELECT population FROM world WHERE name='Russia');
4_SELECT_within_SELECT.1: SELECT name FROM world WHERE continent = 'Europe' AND gdp/population > (SELECT gdp/population FROM world WHERE name = 'United Kingdom');
4_SELECT_within_SELECT.2: SELECT name, continent FROM world WHERE continent IN (SELECT continent FROM world WHERE name = 'Argentina' UNION SELECT continent FROM world WHERE name = 'Australia') ORDER BY name;
4_SELECT_within_SELECT.3: SELECT name, population FROM world WHERE population > (SELECT population FROM world WHERE name = 'United Kingdom') AND population < (SELECT population FROM world WHERE name = 'Germany');
4_SELECT_within_SELECT.4: SELECT name, CONCAT(ROUND(population / (SELECT population FROM world WHERE name = 'Germany') * 100, 0), '%') AS population_as_percentage_of_german_population FROM world WHERE continent = 'Europe';
4_SELECT_within_SELECT.5: SELECT name FROM world WHERE gdp > ALL(SELECT gdp FROM world WHERE continent = 'Europe' AND gdp > 0);
4_SELECT_within_SELECT.6: SELECT continent, name, area FROM world x WHERE area >= ALL(SELECT area FROM world y WHERE y.continent = x.continent AND population > 0);
4_SELECT_within_SELECT.7: SELECT continent, name FROM world x WHERE name = (SELECT name FROM world y WHERE y.continent = x.continent ORDER BY name LIMIT 1);
4_SELECT_within_SELECT.8: SELECT name, continent, population FROM world WHERE continent IN(SELECT DISTINCT continent FROM world WHERE continent NOT IN (SELECT continent FROM world WHERE population > 25000000));
4_SELECT_within_SELECT.9: SELECT name, continent FROM world x WHERE population > (3 * (SELECT population FROM world y WHERE x.continent = y.continent ORDER BY population DESC LIMIT 1 OFFSET 1));

5_SUM_and_COUNT.2: SELECT SUM(gdp) as 'Africa_GDP' FROM world WHERE continent = 'Africa';
5_SUM_and_COUNT.3: SELECT COUNT(name) AS 'countries_with_area_over_1000000' FROM world WHERE area >= 1000000;
5_SUM_and_COUNT.4: SELECT SUM(population) as 'combined_population_estonia_latvia_lithuania' FROM world WHERE name IN('Estonia', 'Latvia', 'Lithuania');
5_SUM_and_COUNT.5: SELECT continent, COUNT(name) AS 'country_count' FROM world GROUP BY continent;
5_SUM_and_COUNT.6: SELECT continent, COUNT(name) FROM world WHERE population >= 10000000 GROUP BY continent;
5_SUM_and_COUNT.7: SELECT continent FROM world GROUP BY continent HAVING (SUM(population) > 100000000);

6_JOIN.0: SELECT matchid, player FROM goal WHERE teamid = 'GER';
6_JOIN.1: SELECT id, stadium, team1, team2 FROM game WHERE id = 1012;
6_JOIN.2: SELECT player, teamid, stadium, mdate FROM game JOIN goal ON (id=matchid) WHERE teamid = 'GER';
6_JOIN.3: SELECT team1, team2, player FROM game JOIN goal ON (id=matchid) WHERE player LIKE 'Mario%';
6_JOIN.4: SELECT player, teamid, coach, gtime FROM goal JOIN eteam on teamid = id WHERE gtime <= 10;
6_JOIN.5: SELECT mdate, teamname FROM game JOIN eteam ON team1 = eteam.id WHERE coach = 'Fernando Santos';
6_JOIN.6: SELECT player FROM game JOIN goal ON id = matchid WHERE stadium = 'National Stadium, Warsaw';
6_JOIN.7: SELECT DISTINCT player FROM game JOIN goal ON matchid = id WHERE (team1 = 'GER' OR team2 = 'GER') AND NOT teamid = 'GER';
6_JOIN.8: SELECT teamname, COUNT(matchid) AS 'goals_scored' FROM eteam JOIN goal ON id=teamid GROUP BY teamname;
6_JOIN.9: SELECT stadium, COUNT(matchid) AS 'goals_scored' FROM game JOIN goal ON id = matchid GROUP BY stadium;
6_JOIN.10: SELECT matchid, mdate, COUNT(matchid) AS 'goals_scored' FROM game JOIN goal ON id = matchid WHERE (team1 = 'POL' OR team2 = 'POL') GROUP BY matchid;
6_JOIN.11: SELECT matchid, mdate, COUNT(matchid) FROM game JOIN goal ON id = matchid WHERE teamid = 'GER' GROUP BY matchid;
6_JOIN.12: SELECT mdate, team1, SUM(CASE WHEN teamid = team1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS score1, team2, SUM(CASE WHEN teamid = team2 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS score2 FROM game LEFT JOIN goal ON matchid = id GROUP BY mdate, matchid, team1, team2;

7_More_JOIN_operations.0: SELECT id, title FROM movie WHERE yr = 1962;
7_More_JOIN_operations.1: SELECT yr FROM movie WHERE title = 'Citizen Kane';
7_More_JOIN_operations.2: SELECT id, title, yr FROM movie WHERE title LIKE('Star Trek%') ORDER BY yr;
7_More_JOIN_operations.3: SELECT id FROM actor WHERE name = 'Glenn Close';
7_More_JOIN_operations.4: SELECT id FROM movie WHERE title = 'Casablanca';
7_More_JOIN_operations.5: SELECT name FROM movie JOIN casting ON movie.id = movieid JOIN actor ON actor.id = actorid WHERE movieid = 11768;
7_More_JOIN_operations.6: SELECT name FROM movie JOIN casting ON movie.id = movieid JOIN actor ON actor.id = actorid WHERE title = 'Alien';
7_More_JOIN_operations.7: SELECT title FROM movie JOIN casting ON movie.id = movieid JOIN actor ON actor.id = actorid WHERE name = 'Harrison Ford';
7_More_JOIN_operations.8: SELECT title FROM movie JOIN casting ON movie.id = movieid JOIN actor ON actor.id = actorid WHERE name = 'Harrison Ford' AND ord != 1;
7_More_JOIN_operations.9: SELECT title, name FROM movie JOIN casting ON movie.id = movieid JOIN actor ON actor.id = actorid WHERE yr = '1962' AND ord = 1;
7_More_JOIN_operations.10: SELECT yr, COUNT(title) FROM movie JOIN casting ON movie.id = movieid JOIN actor ON actorid = actor.id WHERE name = 'Rock Hudson' GROUP BY yr HAVING COUNT(title) > 2;
7_More_JOIN_operations.11: SELECT title, name FROM movie JOIN casting ON movie.id = movieid JOIN actor ON actorid = actor.id WHERE movieid IN(SELECT movieid FROM casting JOIN actor ON actorid = actor.id WHERE name = 'Julie Andrews') AND ord = 1;
7_More_JOIN_operations.12: SELECT name FROM actor JOIN casting ON id = actorid WHERE ord = 1 GROUP BY name HAVING COUNT(ord) >= 15;
7_More_JOIN_operations.13: SELECT title, COUNT(actorid) as 'actor_count' FROM movie JOIN casting ON id = movieid WHERE yr = 1978 GROUP BY title ORDER BY COUNT(actorid) DESC, title;
7_More_JOIN_operations.14: SELECT name FROM actor JOIN casting ON id = actorid WHERE movieid IN(SELECT movieid FROM casting JOIN actor ON actorid = id WHERE name = 'Art Garfunkel') AND name != 'Art Garfunkel';

8_Using_Null.0: SELECT name FROM teacher WHERE dept IS NULL;
8_Using_Null.1: SELECT teacher.name, dept.name FROM teacher INNER JOIN dept ON (teacher.dept = dept.id);
8_Using_Null.2: SELECT teacher.name, dept.name FROM teacher LEFT JOIN dept on teacher.dept = dept.id;
8_Using_Null.3: SELECT teacher.name, dept.name FROM teacher RIGHT JOIN dept on teacher.dept = dept.id;
8_Using_Null.5: SELECT teacher.name, COALESCE(dept.name, 'None') FROM teacher LEFT JOIN dept ON teacher.dept = dept.id;
8_Using_Null.7: SELECT dept.name, COUNT(teacher.id) FROM teacher RIGHT JOIN dept ON teacher.dept = dept.id GROUP BY dept.name;
8_Using_Null.8: SELECT name, CASE WHEN dept = 1 OR dept = 2 THEN 'Sci' ELSE 'Art' END FROM teacher;
8_Using_Null.9: SELECT name, CASE WHEN dept = 1 OR dept = 2 THEN 'Sci' WHEN dept = 3 THEN 'Art' ELSE 'None' END FROM teacher;

8+_Numeric_Examples.0: SELECT A_STRONGLY_AGREE FROM nss WHERE question='Q01' AND institution='Edinburgh Napier University' AND subject = '(8) Computer Science';
8+_Numeric_Examples.1: SELECT institution, subject FROM nss WHERE question='Q15' AND score >= 100;
8+_Numeric_Examples.2: SELECT institution, score FROM nss WHERE question='Q15' AND subject='(8) Computer Science' AND score < 50;
8+_Numeric_Examples.3: SELECT subject, SUM(response) FROM nss WHERE question='Q22' AND (subject='(8) Computer Science' OR subject='(H) Creative Arts and Design') GROUP BY subject;
8+_Numeric_Examples.4: SELECT subject, SUM(response * A_STRONGLY_AGREE / 100) FROM nss WHERE question='Q22' AND (subject='(8) Computer Science' OR subject='(H) Creative Arts and Design') GROUP BY subject;
8+_Numeric_Examples.5: SELECT subject, ROUND(SUM(response * A_STRONGLY_AGREE) / SUM(response), 0) FROM nss WHERE question='Q22' AND (subject='(8) Computer Science' OR subject='(H) Creative Arts and Design') GROUP BY subject;
8+_Numeric_Examples.6: SELECT institution, ROUND(SUM(response * score) / SUM(response), 0) AS 'avg_score' FROM nss WHERE question='Q22' AND (institution LIKE '%Manchester%') GROUP BY institution;
8+_Numeric_Examples.7: SELECT institution, SUM(sample), SUM(CASE WHEN subject = '(8) Computer Science' THEN sample ELSE 0 END) FROM nss WHERE question='Q01' AND (institution LIKE '%Manchester%') GROUP BY institution;
